messages.messageBody:
http://www.shinsengumihq.com/saitouhajime.htm
look in the section "life as Saitou Hajime"
and there is a paragraph in blue which is linked to the new [chronology]
go to the year [1863] which concerns a document circulated amongst
Aizu officials--Hirotada Tokugawa translated this quote from Akama
Shizuko's book (all the citation stuff is on the page)

what is a "metsuke"? and wasn't Tokio's daddy an O-metsuke?
to learn the difference please see the "career" chronology linked
right at the top of Saitou's chronology
http://www.shinsengumihq.com/NSNR.htm
scroll down and look for Metsuke vs O-metsuke (they were not -always-
spies, for example during the Tokugawa mission to the USA, the metsuke
set curfews and hotel "lock downs" and were basically security guards,
they had many roles related to discipline)

so many timelines!
yeah, see if I put SAitou's Meiji Chronology right on the page it
would look just as bad as Tokio's page

what can we learn from the chronology? and can it be a background for
fiction?
http://www.shinsengumihq.com/NSNR.htm
see [1879] Goro and Tokio's 2nd son Tsuyoshi was born 4 days before
Goro received the Order of the Blue Paulownia and 100 yen for his
service during the Seinan War---thus those days were a bit "busy" for
the Fujitas

look for the revolt of the IMperial Guard...this was a very important
and dangerous situation for the capital...again Fujita Goro would've
been totally aware of this...in 1887 people were banished from the
Tokyo---literally an order was sent for hundreds of people to GET OUT
OF TOKYO---you will see the Imperial Rescript (which totally affected
Tokio's sphere/career teachers did not ask for these laws--notice
again it is the military controlling all branches)

similarly in the case of Tokio, her husband and brother were sent to
the Seinan War while she was a ***brand new mother---lots of stress there

http://www.shinsengumihq.com/TakagiTokioinfo.htm
see the section on "EArly LIfe" with a paragraph translated by
Hirotada Tokugawa---it shows that the Takagis have been O-metsuke for
GENERATIONS (*_*)----yet another fictional possibility---super spy
family LOL!!!

[Gohatto Trivia]
Can you identify all the characters in this pic?
http://1happyturtle.com/SakamotoRyuichi/ryuichigohatto.jpg
ofcourse you can pick out Hijikata Beat Takeshi
and Ryuhei Matsuda as Sozaburo Kano (the "wanted" man in the Shinsengumi)
the guy in the chair is the director Oshima Nagisa

there seems to be some confusion about the guy to the left of the
director--he is not the photography/lighting guy---he composed the
weird soundtrack for GOHATTO his named is Sakamoto Ryuichi
http://www.imdb.com/name/nm0757098/
best known to anime fans as the guy who scored

[anime] Mamoru Oshii's APPLESEED (2004)
[vid game] SEven Samurai
and [anime] Wings of Honneamise: Royal Space Force

Gohatto is the second collaboration between Oshima, Beat Takeshi and
Sakamoto, there first was the film "Merry Christmas, Mr. Lawrence"
